examples: Phobia sufferers often find themselves virtual prisoners in their own home.
Phobias are an intense fear of an object or situation.
But people have phobias of all kinds of other animals.
Phobias aren’t uncommon, either.
Some common phobias include spiders, getting shots, or public speaking.
words.defineEn: a great fear of an object or situation that is irrational
words.defineVi: một nỗi sợ hãi lớn về một đối tượng hoặc tình huống không hợp lý

words.defineEn: a strong dislike or fear of England, its people, or its culture.
words.defineVi: cực kỳ ghét hoặc sợ hãi nước Anh, con người hoặc văn hóa của nước này.

examples: It’s even more common than acrophobia, the fear of heights.
words.defineEn: an irrational and persistent fear of being high above ground level
words.defineVi: một nỗi sợ hãi phi lý và dai dẳng khi ở trên cao so với mặt đất

examples: Racism and xenophobia is a political strategy.
Historically, pandemics have stoked xenophobia.
He did not create the xenophobia, the nationalism, the backlash against globalism and global crusades.
Economic frustrations can easily be channeled into racism and xenophobia.
You know, to me that’s xenophobia.
words.defineEn: an unreasonable dislike or prejudice against strangers or foreigners
words.defineVi: không thích hoặc thành kiến vô lý đối với người lạ hoặc người nước ngoài

examples: The guards shot Zodiac.
'No, Ukiah,' Zodiac said quietly.
Zodiac laughed angrily.
He looked at Zodiac.
'You know about Zodiac?
words.defineEn: (astrology) a circular chart divided into twelve parts, which is believed to predict a person's future based on position of different planets
words.defineVi: (chiêm tinh học) một biểu đồ hình tròn được chia thành mười hai phần, được cho là dự đoán tương lai của một người dựa trên vị trí của các hành tinh khác nhau

examples: He is consulting his zodiacal chart to determine his compatibility with different signs.
It's called the zodiacal light.
words.defineEn: related to or associated with the zodiac or the twelve astrological signs
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc liên quan đến cung hoàng đạo hoặc mười hai dấu hiệu chiêm tinh

examples: The constant noise from the construction site vexed the residents of the neighborhood.
words.defineEn: to annoy, irritate, or provoke someone or cause them distress
words.defineVi: làm phiền, chọc tức, hoặc chọc tức ai đó hoặc khiến họ đau khổ

examples: The long delay at the airport caused her great vexation as she was running late for an important meeting.
words.defineEn: the state of being annoyed, irritated, or frustrated
words.defineVi: trạng thái khó chịu, cáu kỉnh hoặc thất vọng

examples: The vexatious customer continued to make unreasonable demands, causing a headache for the customer service representative.
words.defineVi: gây khó chịu, thất vọng, hoặc đau khổ

words.defineEn: a turning aside (of your course or attention or concern)
words.defineVi: quay sang một bên (của khóa học hoặc sự chú ý hoặc mối quan tâm của bạn)

examples: This has positive divergence right over here.
So the divergence is negative in this situation.
So we have positive divergence.
What is the divergence at F at each point?
Here we were summing the divergence in the region.
words.defineEn: the act of spreading or moving apart in different directions
words.defineVi: hành động lan rộng hoặc di chuyển ra xa theo các hướng khác nhau

examples: Divergent thinkers are able to generate creative ideas by exploring many possible solutions.
These three divergent devils are all based on Satan of the Old Testament, an angelic member of God’s court who torments Job in the Book of Job.
The North American plate and the Eurasian Plate are pulling apart and these divergent plates or what's called the mid-Atlantic ridge.
The same study found that people with selective gating were more likely to exhibit divergent thinking, which is another form of creativity.
If for whatever reason this was unbounded and we couldn't come up with some type of a finite number here, if the area was infinite, we would say that it is divergent.
words.defineEn: differing or deviating from each other, showing a contrast
words.defineVi: khác nhau hoặc lệch khỏi nhau, cho thấy một sự tương phản

examples: The African landscape is diverse, ranging from lush rainforests to vast deserts.
The restaurant offered a diverse menu to cater to different tastes and dietary restrictions - horses for courses.
Italy's Mediterranean climate and diverse geography offer a wide range of outdoor activities
The farmers grew a diverse range of accessory fruits on their orchard, including grapes and blueberries.
The forest is home to a diverse range of plant and animal species.
words.defineEn: being of various and different types
words.defineVi: có nhiều loại và khác nhau

examples: But the 20th century brought new diversions into British homes.
Even in the composer's own time, Vivaldi's music served as diversion for all, not just for the wealthy aristocrats.
And to understand that, we need to take a brief diversion into atomic structure.
While New York only covered three percent of costs with its fees, the data shows a troubling reality that has long haunted advocates, diversion of funds.
I find this whole, I find this whole little diversion very disturbing.
words.defineEn: an activity that diverts or amuses or stimulates
words.defineVi: một hoạt động chuyển hướng hoặc giải trí hoặc kích thích

examples: Brown algae have complex life cycles with genetic diversity.
He joined ESPN, which already had a culture of inclusion and diversity, but he took it up a notch.
Traveling to a foreign country allowed me to see my own culture and values in a new light, gaining a broader perspective and appreciation for diversity.
I try to appreciate the diversity of cultures and not let stereotypes influence my opinions, because a black plum is as sweet as a white one.
To take in diversity.
words.defineEn: a range of things or people that are significantly different from each other
words.defineVi: một loạt những thứ hoặc những người khác biệt đáng kể với nhau

examples: A firefly diverts oxygen to its light cells through its tracheoles.
Our domestic political squabbles divert our national attention from the three great challenges America faces.
And, in Phoenix, six area hospitals are diverting incoming emergency patients to other facilities.
You can divert the laminar flow, and the streamlines, stay in the same orientation.
As that fluid rushes around your body, some of it is diverted from the blood into the salivary gland.
words.defineVi: quay sang một bên; quay lưng lại

examples: Local farmers burn wood in outdoor kilns to make charcoal for cooking fuel.
And then towards the end of the video, you see this small kiln on the right-hand side.
And colobus monkeys visit these kilns when they’re not in use to eat the bits of charcoal left behind.
Once they're completely dry, Ashok fires the diyas in large wood-burning kilns.
To try to avoid this, he usually fires up his kiln overnight.
words.defineEn: a type of furnace or oven that is used for baking pottery, ceramics or bricks
words.defineVi: một loại lò hoặc lò nướng được sử dụng để nướng đồ gốm, gốm sứ hoặc gạch
